comments:
RC1

I used the global 'Import' functionality on the preference page and got the
following exceptions in the log. (several of the same traces as below)

It wasn't reproducable after restarting Eclipse, so maybe some listeners were
not correctly removed, e.g. the remove listener code not in a finally block.

Could be related to bug 64648, i.e. missing dispose call. Bug 64648 is about 
editors, this one about the outline.

Moving to Platform UI.
Looks like we are leaking property change listeners.
Do you still have the preference file that caused this to happen?

Looking at the code I think that the only way this could happen is if we were
disposing the view contents without disposing it.  I'm wondering if some other
preference hits a listener first that causes us to screw up our view lifecycle.

This looks similar to bug 64648, which we're having difficulty reproducing.
Any suggested steps would help.

If the editor's dispose() is not getting called, then any preference change
notification that happens later may fail.  It's not necessarily the preference
change notification causing the the view lifecycle problem.
Martin, have you seen this again in recent builds?

I haven't, but I'm not using this functionality too often. When I did, 
everything worked fine.

Marking as WORKSFORME since nobody can reproduce this, but leaving RC3 tag for
further verification in the verification pass.

Note that since there were several similar PRs which we could not reproduce,
we've added isDisposed checks in out-of-scope listeners in the presentations.
See bug 66224.

This wouldn't cover the case here though.

If you see this again, please shout.
